item.title: Amino Acids and Derivatives
item.description:
Analysis is performed by HILIC based separation coupled to a high-resolution mass spectrometer. The quantitative analysis is ensured by external calibration and isotopically labeled internal standardization.

Metabolites included in this method

  • Amino acids and their derivatives
  • Polyamines
  • Carnitines

Established protcols for following sample types

  • Tissue (minimum 30 mg)
  • Plasma and serum (minimum 15 µl)
  • Cell cultures (minimum 1million cells)

item.title: Biocrates Kit
item.description:
In addition to standard workflow, metabolomics measurements can be performed with AbsoluteIDQ p180 and p400 HR kits from Biocrates.

Metabolites included in this method

  • Amino acids and biogenic amines
  • Acylcarnitines
  • Glycerolphospholipids and Sphingolipids
  • Hexose

Established protcols for following sample types

  • Tissue (minimum 30 mg)
  • Plasma and serum (minimum 15 µl)
  • Cell cultures (minimum 1 million cells)

item.title: Central Carbon Metabolites
item.description:
Analysis of central carbon metabolites, including glycolysis, pentose phosphate pathway

Metabolites included in this method

  • Acylcarnitines
  • Amino acids
  • Amino acid derivatives
  • Biogenic acids
  • Carboxylic acids
  • Cofactors
  • Nucleosides/Nucleobases
  • Nucleotides
  • Phenyl acids
  • Sugar derivatives
  • Sugar phosphates
  • Vitamins

Metabolite analysis has been established for following sample types

  • Tissue (minimum 30 mg)
  • Plasma and serum (minimum 15 µl)
  • Cell cultures (minimum 1million cells)

item.title: Quantiative Profiling of Lipids
item.description:
Lipid analysis is performed by reversed phase liquid chromatography coupled to a cutting edge high-resolution tribrid mass spectrometer. This assay provides a semi-quantitative analysis for several lipid classes, referring to one isotopically-labeled internal standard per class.

Metabolites included in this method

  • Phospholipids (PC, PE, PS, PG)
  • Sphingolipids (SM, Cer)
  • Glycerolipids (DG, TG)
  • Cholesterylesters

Established protcols for following sample types

  • Tissue (minimum 30 mg)
  • Plasma and serum (minimum 15 µl)
  • Cell cultures (minimum 1million cells)

item.title: Quantiative Profiling of Lipids
item.description:
Lipid analysis is performed by reversed phase liquid chromatography coupled to a cutting edge high-resolution tribrid mass spectrometer. This assay provides a semi-quantitative analysis for several lipid classes, referring to one isotopically-labeled internal standard per class.

Metabolites included in this method

  • Phospholipids (PC, PE, PS, PG)
  • Sphingolipids (SM, Cer)
  • Glycerolipids (DG, TG)
  • Cholesterylesters

Established protcols for following sample types

  • Tissue (minimum 30 mg)
  • Plasma and serum (minimum 15 µl)
  • Cell cultures (minimum 1million cells)

item.title: TCA/Urea Cycle
item.description:
This analysis is performed by reversed phase liquid chromatography coupled to tandem mass spectrometry, operating in multiple reaction mode. For quantification, an external calibration and two isotopically-labeled internal standards are applied.

Established protcols for following sample types

  • Tissue (minimum 30 mg)
  • Plasma and serum (minimum 15 µl)
  • Cell cultures (minimum 1million cells)

item.title: A genetically-determined sequence of physiological processes defines developmental root senescence
